<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Ghost Hunter Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=2277) <actions string="" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Abomination Vaults</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #163: Ruins of Gauntlight](/Sources.aspx?ID=71) pg. 81</row>

**Archetype** [Ghost Hunter](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=88)

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) or Trained in [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)

</column>

---

You have focused your training on hunting and defeating ghosts, spirits, and all manner of haunts. Pick [Spirit Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) or Haunt Lore; you become trained in this skill. If you were already trained in both skills, you become trained in a new Lore skill of your choice.

 Choose two cantrips from the occult spell list. Each cantrip must have the [divination](/Traits.aspx?ID=47), [enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), or [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117) trait. You can cast these spells as innate occult spells. You gain access to the Cast a Spell activity if you didn't have it already. You're trained in occult spell attack rolls and spell DCs. You can usually replace material components with somatic components, so you don't need a spell component pouch. Your key spellcasting ability for these spells is Charisma.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the ghost hunter archetype.

<title level="2">Ghost Hunter Dedication leads to...</title>
[Ghost Strike](/Feats.aspx?ID=2281), [Grave's Voice](/Feats.aspx?ID=2278), [Investigate Haunting](/Feats.aspx?ID=2279), [Peer Beyond](/Feats.aspx?ID=2282), [Spirit Spells](/Feats.aspx?ID=2280)
name: Ghost Hunter Dedication
prerequisite: Trained in Occultism or Trained in Religion
